snippet: The family members, making their first public comments about a $5.9 million payment from New York City, revived their calls for a federal case against the officers involved in Mr. Garner’s death.
abstract: Family of Eric Garner, Staten Island man who died at hands of police in 2014, sign $5.9 million settlement with New York City comptroller Scott M Stringer but say agreement does not mean end to their call for reform; ask for federal charges to be brought

byline.original: By J. DAVID GOODMAN and NIKITA STEWART

lead_paragraph: The family members, making their first public comments about a $5.9 million payment from New York City, revived their calls for a federal case against the officers involved in Mr. Garner’s death.

headline.main: Eric Garner’s Family Says Settlement Will Not Stall Push for Police Reform
headline.print_headline: Garner Family Says Settlement Won’t End Call for Reform
